After capturing Hattifatteners, players try to move to the Treasure Card space in order to exchange their Hattifatteners for treasure cards. A player can only draw from the Treasure Card stack if they roll the die to a number greater than or equal to the amount of Hattifatteners they have currently captured. If successful, a player draws the same amount of treasure cards as the amount of Hattifatteners they hold.

Treasure cards have differing point values and movement events.

Name: Delver: Heroes of Farenwald
Description:
Delver: Heroes of Farenwald is a 4-7 Player competitive TableTop RPG Card game where players seek to be named the first Hero of the fictional city of Farenwald.

Players are dealt a class card who will be their Adventurer for the game. These Adventurers have stats indicating how good they are in specific areas (Attack, Defend, Heal, Discuss, Dexterity). Each Adventurer also has a unique class ability they may use once per game.

Players will then draw Tactic Cards that will help them tell their story as Hero, or help them impede the other players story.

At the beginning of the round, a Game Master will reveal a Battlefield card for that round of play. The Battlefield Card effects all players for that round and can help or hurt their efforts, but dynamically changes each round.

The players will then take turns deciding to delve into the Town or Dungeon Zones, handling specific fantasy scenarios. Such as, saving a farmhand from a cave troll or planting poison on a noblewoman. They will choose which of their skills they will utilize to handle these scenarios and roll the dice. The Game Master will determine their success and reward them with treasure.

You receive individual Victory Points for the Town and Dungeon Area. The first with two of each will be named the Hero of Farenwald.

—description from the publisher

Name: One Night Werewolf x Hoshi no Kirby
Description:
A collaboration with popular character Kirby for this installment in the One Night Werewolf series.

The skilled Chef Kawasaki has concocted a new menu and has invited Kirby and friends for a tasting. But just when everyone has gathered and its time to reveal the tasty dishes...it seems as if they have already been eaten by someone sneaky!

Work together to try and figure out who is the guilty glutton.

Like other versions of One Night Werewolf, this game features special role cards such as Kirby who can inhale another character resulting in two players exchanging role cards.

Name: Zirafa
Description:
Zirafa is a children game of dexterity and memory. To be the tallest giraffe you must win the neck parts finding equals flowers. Then you have to place them one on the top of others being carefully because if the giraffe collapse, you have to built it back or you will lost your next turn.

—user summary

Name: Corner Crush
Description: Your goal in Corner Crush is to get four of your pieces in a row before the opponent does, but the "game board" is a rotating tower that has four sides, with each side having two columns for playing pieces, with up to six pieces fitting in a column. You take turns dropping pieces in a column, and since the board is circular, you have to be aware that attacks can come from multiple directions.

Name: RollinKrieg
Description:
You have just landed form a boat in which you have crossed the Volga river after traveling days and nights in the carriage of a military train. You find yourself in front of a city in ruins and blackened boy smoke. You are handed a rifle with five cartridges and a commissioner orders you and your companions to advance through the rubble among the threatening bullets of the enemy.

Rollinkrieg is a series of Roll and Write games in which you immerse yourself in the scene of the wildest and most memorable battle in human history: The Battle of Stalingrado, during World War II, where the tireless Red Army faced with the terrible Wehrmacht. Barmelej Chapter is the first game in thee series which is characterized by having the emblematic Barmelej Fountain on its stage. The objective of the game is to complete the mission that are given to you before losing all of your Life Points.

1) GAME COMPOSITION:

    Game Sheets 1 and 2. 
    Rules. 
    Pencil and eraser (or erasable marker). 
    8 m.m. cubes (optional). 


2) GAME SHEET: 
Game Sheet 1 contains the map of the scenario where the player will move to complete  the mission, as well as Life, Energy and Time indicators. There also the tracks of  weapons you got and their respective amount of Ammunition. There are also the track 
of Focus, Morale status and record of explored blocks and captured enemy weapons. 
On the Game Sheet 2 are the Events player faces each turn.

Name: Cluckle
Description: Each round in Cluckle, someone squeezes the rubber chicken to pop out the "egg" die and determine the length of word that each player needs to create. Everyone then races to flip over their egg tiles to see which letters they have. Create a word of the proper length as quickly as you can, then grab the chicken to win the round.

Name: Action Dice Football
Description:
Action Dice Games! Super Fun Game - Portable, Playing Dice : Perfect For Tailgating at Games, Travel, Home, Parties, Gifts, Stocking Suffers and anywhere you want to play a full sports game fast and realistic.  You call the plays and decide when to go for the bomb or long shot!  Solo or versus, these games are action packed.

This game can be single or two players.  Anyone can play!  To play the game simply choose one of the five offensive plays and roll the dice to see the result.  Each team gets a chance to move the ball down field to score points by calling their own plays.

Keeping track of time in this football game is easy. Provided are score sheets. Each time a play is finished the user will record the down and yardage on this score sheet. After 30 plays are completed, it will show the final score for that quarter of play. The team with the most points wins the game. If the score is tied then an overtime quarter will begin.

What makes Action Dice Games unique is the fact that they are pocket sized, accurate to the professional leagues and very fast results.  There is no play art, player strengths or formations. The result is based off the play you call and the situation you call the play during these games will determine the winner.

Unlike other football games that don't include actual downs and distance, this game does! Just about every down and distance is in this game. Each yard matters here.

—description from the publisher

Name: Champions
Description:
A game of strategy where players are trying to win medals in various disciplines by playing corresponding cards. There are always four different disciplines to score at any time. Gold, silver and bronze medals each can be won only once for each sport. 
In turn, players either exchange cards drawing from the deck or play a matching set to claim the discipline. Others may play higher sets to steal the win or matching ones just to stop the player. 
The game ends when someone wins 5th medal or the deck runs out. Points are counted for each medal won (3 -gold, 2 - silver, 1- bronze. The highest score wins.

Name: Capture: A Book of Mormon Game
Description:
Capture: A Book of Mormon Game is a fast-paced, card-changing, thrilling adventure that is fun for the entire family.

Be the first to collect Lehi and the brass plates or Samuel the Lamanite on the walls of Zarahemla.  But don't blink!  This game moves fast!  Multiple action cards keep this game exciting as players struggle to create a memorable moment from the Book of Mormon -- the first one to accomplish the goal, wins.

Players draw 2 cards and plays 2 cards each turn.  There are special effects for some of the cards.  The game ends once a players played cards match the goal card.

—user summary

Name: Curiosity
Description:
They call me Percival, scholar, dignitary, mystic. I need your help. My studies show that the Cataclysm is approaching. I've been silenced as I beg others to heed my warnings. Luckily I have found a way to stop the Cataclysm. Beneath our very paws is an extensive network of Catacombs, filled with the souls of the mightiest cats before us. I need nine souls from deep within the Catacombs. I would fetch them myself, but my aversion to pestilence prevents me. That is why I hired you. Beware as you cautiously creep through the Catacombs, as there are temptations, monsters, and fates that seek to protect the souls of the lost. Work together to defeat these guardians, using the abilities that the Fates have granted you. You may keep whatever treasure you find, which might help you on your little adventure, but bring me the souls. Learn from the mistakes that lead to their demise as you trudge back into the dungeon. Gather your Clowder and make haste, but beware: For we all know what killed the cat.

Curiosity is a cat themed cooperative deck-building campaign where players work together to attempt to escape the Catacombs. The game has three modes: Campaign, Arcade, and Trials.

In the Campaign mode, players will be helping an NPC named Percival figure out how to prevent the impending Cataclysm in exchange for information on how to escape the Catacombs. Players will be working together to build their individual decks, defeat guardians, and unlock new playable classes. There are over ten scenarios.

In Arcade mode, players will complete a randomly generated scenario. Content unlocked in Campaign mode are also available in this mode!

In Trials mode, players will work together to go as far into the Catacombs as they can before they exhaust themselves, battling hoards of Guardians.

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Everything Box
Description:
The Everything Box comes with 300 all-new cards to add to your deck of Cards Against Humanity.  The box has a bagel on it.

- We'd like to say we called it the Everything Box because it holds a mirror to our fragmented, chaotic world, where everything is monetized and opiate-peddling megacorporations control us with amoral social media algorithms.

- But honestly, we were just hungry.

- Bagel not included.

~Publisher's website

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Family Edition – Glow in the Dark Box
Description:
Want more Family Edition? We got it. The Glow in the Dark Box comes with 300 all-new cards that will make you poop yourself with delight all over again.

- Includes 300 ridiculous new cards to mix into your game.

- The box glows in the dark, making it easy to find in a cave.

- Includes bonus glow-in-the-dark stickers!

- Sorry, the cards don’t glow, that would be too much glowing.

~Publisher's Website

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 1
Description:
If a picture is worth a thousand words, then this pack has over 30,000 words! That’s more words than the Bible.

- Comes with 30 all-new cards to seamlessly mix into your game.

- Each card has a picture on it, and sometimes words too!

- We can't believe we didn't think of this before.

~Publisher's website

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 2
Description:
That’s right, it’s Picture Card Pack 2 — the greatest sequel since Terminator 2: Judgment Day!

- 30 more all-new cards with completely different pictures on them.

- Also some words, but not too many.

- Goes great with Picture Card Pack 1.

~Publisher's website
